data.title: Athletes Born on April 21
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in sport for the 21st of April. Browse birthdays of sports stars, managers and coaches that were born on April 21.
data.text:
Ted Barratt, English cricket spin bowler (10-43 in tour match vs Australia 1878; MCC, Surrey CCC), born in Stockton-on-Tees, England (d. 1891)

Joe McCarthy

American Baseball Hall of Fame manager (Chicago Cubs; New York Yankees - World Series 1932, 36–39, 41, 43; Boston Red Sox), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Steve Owen, American Pro Football Hall of Fame tackle (NY Giants) and coach (NFL C'ship 1927, 34, 38; NY Giants), born in Cleo Springs, Oklahoma (d. 1964)

Louis Hostin, French weightlifter (Olympic gold 1932, 36), born in Saint-Étienne, France (d. 1998)

John Goddard, West Indian cricket all-rounder and captain (27 Tests @ 30.67; 33 wickets; Barbados), born in St Michael, Barbados (d. 1987)

Edmund Adamkiewicz, German soccer forward (2 caps; Hamburger SV, Eintracht Frankfurt), born in Hamburg, Germany (d. 1991)

Allan Watkins, Welsh cricket all-rounder, (15 Tests, England @ 40.15, 11 wickets; Glamorgan), born in Usk, Wales (d. 2011)

Arthur Rowley, English soccer forward (most goals in English league football, 434 from 619 games; Leicester City, Shrewsbury Town), born in Wolverhampton, England (d. 2002)

Morgan Wootten, American Basketball Hall of Fame coach (46 seasons DeMatha Catholic HS, Hyattsville, Maryland; National C'ships 1962, 65, 68, 78, 84), born in Durham, North Carolina (d. 2020)

Angela Mortimer

British tennis player (French C'ships 1955, Australian C'ships 1958, Wimbledon 1961), born in Plymouth, England

Martin Horton, cricketer, England off-spin all rounder, 2 Tests 1959)

Robin Dixon, England, 2 man bobsled (Olympic gold 1960)

Bob Cleary

American hockey HOF center (Olympic gold 1960; Harvard University), born in Cambridge, Massachusetts

Gary Peters, American baseball pitcher (MLB All Star 1964, 67; AL Rookie of the Year 1963; AL wins leader 1964; Chicago WS, Boston Red Sox), born in Grove City, Pennsylvania (d. 2023)

Brendan Malone, American basketball coach (RI Uni; Toronto Raptors, Cleveland Cavaliers), born in New York City (d. 2023)

Hannes Viljoen, South African rugby union winger (3 caps; Natal), born in Elliot, South Africa (d. 2021)

Adrian Hurley, Australian basketball coach (Australian Boomers 1988, 92 Olympics; 1986, 90 World C'ships), born in Bega, Australia

S Venkataraghavan, cricket (Indian off-spinner, Test ump, ICC referee)

Tony Danza, American boxer and actor (Taxi,- "Tony"; The Tony Danza Show - "Tony"; Who's the Boss - "Tony"), born in Brooklyn, New York

Ed Fiori, American golfer (4 PGA Tour titles), born in Lynwood, California

Dale Eggeling, American golfer (3 LPGA titles), born in Statesboro, Georgia

Rick DeMont, American 400m swimmer, drug disqualification (1972 Olympics)

Jesse Orosco, pitcher (NY Mets, Orioles, Dodgers), born in Santa Barbara, California

Julius Korir, Kenya, 3K steeplechaser (Olympic gold 1984)

Les Lancaster, American baseball player

Ken Caminiti, MLB third baseman, 1987-2001, (Houston Astros, San Diego Padres, and 3 other teams; NL MVP- 1996), born in Hanford, California (d. 2004)

Ludmila Engquist, Swedish athlete (Olympic gold 100m hurdles 1996; World C'ship gold 1991 [rep. USSR], 97), born in Tambov Oblast, Russia

Ed Belfour, Canadian Hockey Hall of Fame goaltender (Olympic gold 2001, Vezina Trophy 1991, 93), born in Carman, Manitoba

1965 Gary Grant, NBA guard (NY Knicks)

Judy Diduck, ice hockey defenseman (Canada, Olympics 1998)

Peter van Foxes, soccer player (Ajax)

Conrad Clarks, NFL center (Indianapolis Colts)

Israel Stanley, NFL/WLAF defensive end (New Orleans Saints, Rhein Fire)

Samantha Druce, British swimmer, youngest woman to swim English Channel

1971 Tony McGee, American NFL football tight end, 1993-2003 (Cincinnati Bengals, and 4 other teams), born in Terre Haute, Indiana

Gwendal Peizerat, French ice dancer (2002 Olympic Gold), born in Bron, France

Jonathan Nsenga, Belgian athlete

Danyon Loader, New Zealand 200m and 400m swimmer (2 Olympic gold medals 1996), born in Dunedin, New Zealand

Rommel Adducul, Filipino basketball player, born in Tuguegarao, Cagayan, Philippines

Jacob Burns, Australian footballer

Jeff Keppinger, American baseball player

1980 Tony Romo, American football player

1980 Vincent Lecavalier, Canadian hockey player

Paweł Brożek, Polish footballer

Alexander Edler, Swedish NHL hockey defenseman (Vancouver Canucks), born in Östersund, Sweden

Nadif Chowdhury, Bangladeshi cricketer

Pedro Mosquera, Spanish footballer

Karolis Chvedukas, Lithuanian soccer midfielder (20 caps; FK Sūduva 163 games, Waterford FC), born in Marijampolė, Lithuania (d. 2023)

1991 Max Chilton, British Formula One and IndyCar racing driver, born in Redhill, England
